solution_line_template: First find how many minute Andy had to get to school when he left his house: {school_start_hour}:00 AM - {leave_hour}:{leave_minute} AM = {time_available} minutes

Then find the total time he spent waiting at red lights: {red_light_wait} minutes/light * {num_red_lights} lights = <<{red_light_wait}*{num_red_lights}={total_red_light_time}>>{total_red_light_time} minutes

Now add the normal travel time, red light time, and construction wait time to find Andy's total travel time: {normal_travel_time} minutes + {total_red_light_time} minutes + {construction_wait} minutes = <<{normal_travel_time}+{total_red_light_time}+{construction_wait}={total_travel_time}>>{total_travel_time} minutes

Now subtract the amount of time Andy had when he left his house from that number to find how many minute late he is: {total_travel_time} minutes - {time_available} minutes = <<{total_travel_time}-{time_available}={minutes_late}>>{minutes_late} minutes
